text: hi my name is Rebecca and today's video
we're going to talk about how to
communicate more effectively in English
specifically we're going to talk about
how to warn your listener when you're
about to give them some bad news after
they have asked you something or said
something to you now this situation may
arise in a personal situation or in a
professional context so we're going to
give you some examples in both cases
alright let's look at the first one
let's say somebody asks you do you like
this dress on me and actually you don't
right so we've use certain keywords
before we start expressing our opinion
to kind of warn the listener that we're
about to say something that they might
not like to hear very much and they use
these words just to soften the tone of
our message because our message is
communicated not only with the words we
use and also with the tone that we
express so if somebody asks you do you
like this dress on me you could say
actually I like the other one better or
you could say well I think the other one
makes you look taller or to be honest I
love that other one on you now in each
of these cases
I didn't say even once that I don't like
that on you but I communicated the same
idea by expressing it in a different way
and by warning the listener that I was
going to give an opinion which perhaps
is not the most positive one that they
were hoping to hear okay let's look at
how this might occur in a professional
con
let's suppose you're asked what do you
think of my proposal and you really
don't like the proposal you don't agree
with it so you could say again with
respect I think this proposal would not
be effective in helping us achieve our
goals okay you see how it's being used
in a professional context the language
is a little bit more formal so some of
these will work more effectively in the
professional context you could say
actually or well or to be honest also
these are just a little more formal okay
you could also say do you think this
proposal is very effective well as a
matter of fact I think it will not
achieve our objectives or you could say
frankly I don't think this proposal
would help us to achieve our objectives
okay so by using a few words like this
in the beginning of your sentence your
warning your listener and preparing them
to hear something which they may not be
very comfortable hearing and that's our
way of being kind okay I hope this
lesson has helped you and I wish you all
the best in communicating your messages
to whatever audience you have personal
or in a professional context if you'd
like to do a little quiz on this please
visit our website WWE
thanks very much bye for now
